data.title: Error parsing array of objects in package settings (config.cson)
data.body:
The `config.cson` parser seems unable to handle objects within an array. E.g,. take this package settings configuration:

``` coffee
module.exports = MyPackage =
  config:
    MyArrayOfObjects:
      type: 'array'
      default: []
      items:
        type: 'object'
        properties:
          myObjectProperty:
            type: 'string'
```

The following  `config.cson` values get removed on parse:

``` cson
"my-module":
  MyArrayOfObjects: [
    {
      myObjectProperty: "I am a setting value"
    }
    {
      myObjectProperty: "I am a another setting value"
    }
  ]
```

data.title: Atom (still) always opens keymap.cson on startup
data.body:
I can consistently reproduce #9155 from scratch. I'm running Atom 1.3.2 on OS X 10.11.2. This happens when run entirely within safe mode as well.
1. Quit Atom
2. `rm -rf ~/.atom/storage/`
3. Launch Atom via `atom --safe`
4. `cmd-,` (does not work the same with Atom > Preferences menu, see below)
5. Click Keybindings in left rail of Settings
6. Click "your keymap file" link in the top help line of the Keybindings page
7. Close `keymap.cson` buffer
8. Quit
9. Relaunch via `atom --safe`.
10. `keymap.cson` is open, and there's no way to fix this without deleting storage or modifying `initialPaths` in `~/.atom/storage/application.json`.

There is also a variant if you use the Atom > Preferences menu in step 4 instead of `cmd-,`, in which the Settings pane is always open on startup instead of keybindings.

data.title: Use OS X Human Interface Guidelines compliant menu order
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10302

Might be worth checking to see if we're compliant on other platforms too, and also checking the order of items in the File, Edit, View, Window, and Help menus.

data.title: If encoding is set to autodetect, it should autodetect on any external file change
data.body:
When external program changes the encoding of an opened file (sets say from UTF8 to UTF16) the file is reload but looks bad.

Every time this happens I must select "change encoding->Auto select" so the files to be shown correctly.

data.title: No good at supporting Chinese encoded in ANSI
data.body: My Chinese text file was save in ANSI-encoding,when I open it in the editor, it does not showed normally.

data.title: git status not work perfect
data.body:
I have the git projects like this:

```
/projects/
  project-a/
    .gitignore
    a.txt  

  project-b/
    .gitignore
    b.txt
```

The `project-a` and `project-b` are all git projects, and I don't want to open many instances of atom.
So I open `/projects` as the folder, but when I open `a.txt`, the `git status` not work, I need to open `/projects/project-a` as the folder.
Is there any way to show git status for any opened file according to the file folder git status?

Sublime can work well for this kind.

data.title: Backport identical tab names fix
data.body:
Fixes Atom hanging indefinitely upon encountering two identical filenames located in different directories in 1.3.x.

(Is cherry-picking the correct way to do this?  It feels really weird creating a PR that uses someone else's commits)

data.title: When the current window is maximized, opening a new window should open the new one maximized
data.body:
From **@50Wliu** on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10236#issuecomment-169855151

> After testing this out on Windows it looks like there needs to be some extra Windows-specific code: opening a new window that spawns from a maximized one should stay maximized and not cascade.

data.body:
This PR will fix #9584 and #9454 on 1.3.3.  Both Electron 0.34.4 and 0.34.5 solely exist to fix the aforementioned issues, so there shouldn't be any compatibility issues with this (hopefully).

Now on the right branch!

Fixes #10331

/cc @joshaber @mnquintana

data.title: Relocate or rename "Reload" menu item to prevent confusion
data.body: See: https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/issues/124

data.title: Opens blank document on startup for unmounted project tree.
data.body:
If one of the project folders references an unmounted drive, the unmounted project folder will be disabled; this is correct and desired behavior. But if the project folder is unmounted, on startup Atom will get confused and also open up a blank document representing the unavailable project folder.

For example, imagine that on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit I add a project folder `X:\foo\bar`. If I later unmount `X:` and start up Atom, the editor will disable the `X:\foo\bar` project folder; this is correct behavior. But Atom will also upon startup open a blank document `bar`. I would expect no blank document `bar` to be opened to represent an unavailable project folder; this is a bug.

(Note that this was originally filed as https://github.com/atom/tree-view/issues/680, and I was told to re-file it here.)

data.title: Build issue npm ERR! network read ECONNRESET on Windows 10
data.body:
I'm getting the following error message while trying to run the build script on Windows 10:

```
PS D:\git\atom> .\script\build
Node: v4.2.4
npm: v2.13.3
Python: v2.7.11
Installing build modules...
=> Took 4388ms.

Installing apm...


npm ERR! Windows_NT 10.0.10240
npm ERR! argv "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node.exe" "D:\\git\\atom\\build\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "--userconfig=D:\\git\\atom\\build\\.npmrc" "--target=0.10.35" "install" "--loglevel" "error"
npm ERR! node v4.2.4
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3
npm ERR! code ECONNRESET
npm ERR! errno ECONNRESET
npm ERR! syscall read
npm ERR! network read ECONNRESET
npm ERR! network This is most likely not a problem with npm itself
npm ERR! network and is related to network connectivity.
npm ERR! network In most cases you are behind a proxy or have bad network settings.
npm ERR! network
npm ERR! network If you are behind a proxy, please make sure that the
npm ERR! network 'proxy' config is set properly.  See: 'npm help config'
```

How can I fix this? I am not behind a proxy.

data.title: Default to using standard GitHub API token during build
data.body:
Resolves an issue where the GitHub API is rate-limited during the build when attempting to download Electron.

/cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Async submodule support
data.body: Well, I split the submodule work out into its own PR hoping that'd make it more easily reviewable, but then I went an added a new fixture with submodules so this PR is back to being unreviewable :cry:

data.title: Fix Windows installer path update woes
data.body:
#5092 and #7757 were worked around with not updating the path if registry tools access disabled in the Windows Group Policy
#5063 was worked around with not updating the path if the path contains characters outside the ASCII range

This addresses both of these with fixes that correctly update the user path under these conditions with the deleting or corruption of the user path resulting from these issues.

data.title: Removing many files - modal overlaping ui
data.body:
Hi there,

When you are deleting lot of files at once, the modal that comes up when you have to confirm that you are sure you want to deleted selected files overlaps UI.

I was wondering if this would be considered as a bug.

![screen shot 2016-01-07 at 16 53 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5247674/12176635/4326b52a-b560-11e5-9764-e9981aff7cd3.png)

data.title: Pasting after closing Atom fails
data.body: I copy some text from a buffer in Atom, then close the application. When I go to paste, my clipboard is empty. I tested with content copied from another application, and that works fine, so Atom isn't just clearing the clipboard. But when trying to paste copied text out of Atom after the application is closed, fails.

data.title: Atom crashes after closing almost every time
data.body:
Using `Atom 1.3.2` on  `OS X 10.11.2`

Within the last couple months, Atom has started crashing almost every time I close the program. No problems while it's running, but when I close out it appears to close just fine, but then pops up the OS X crash dialog. Here's the output: [AtomCrash.txt](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/81351/AtomCrash.txt)

sock.recv(1024)

without the '=' the number is not colored

data.title: Register Atom to open ini files
data.body: Atom should be registered to open ini files so that you can use "Open With->Atom" on any .ini file (which are plain text files)

The shortcut I'm using is "**Alt Gr** and **+**"

Cheers!

data.title: Strips script tags from EJS files
data.body:
I am working on sails and using ejs template engine. I have home.ejs, style.css and main.js files in my project. In home.ejs I have added some script. 
Now Issue is when I save any file other than home.ejs then It remove all script tags from home,ejs. I am wonder why it is only removing script tags and this problem is only with ejs files.
I am using ubunto 14.2 and atom is up-to-dated on my system.
